introduction.title: WELCOME
introduction.subtitle: to my portfolio
introduction.description-first-p: I'm <name>Alice Berthelot</name>, a passionate web developer from France. Former lawyer, I transitioned into web development after falling in love with coding. I'm a full-stack developer, with a special interest for back end.
introduction.description-second-p: Explore my skills, background, and projects through this portfolio.
introduction.description-third-p: Feel free to reach me on the <contact>Contact page</contact>.

job-research.main-sentence: I am seeking opportunities in full-stack development, with a preference for backend:
job-research.internship: 1 to 6-month internship in France, Europe or Canada, starting from January 2025
job-research.employment-contract: CDI or CDD in France, permanent or temporary contract in Europe or Canada
job-research.work-study: French Diploma for Work and Study Programme (alternance) Application Developer and Conceptor (Bachelor Degree): flexible starting date, duration and frequency (already admitted to several programmes)

introduction.work-conditions: Full mobility in France, Europe and Canada - Open to onsite, hybrid or remote work

hardskills-content.other: Notions of CI/CD, Cybersecurity, Generative AI and Web Accessibility

hobbies.title: Hobbies

travels-content.skills: I especially enjoy solo traveling, to go beyond my comfort zone and meet with people from all over the world.
travels-content.solo: Main solo travels: Taiwan (4 months in 2020), tour over Latin America/Oceania/Asia (10 months between 2022 and 2023), Tanzania (1 month in 2024)

hobbies.foodandtea-content: Discovering new flavors from all over the world and attending tea tasting events

ProjectPage.title: Projects
ProjectPage.temporary: In the meantine, you can find my projects on GitHub:
ProjectPage.description-first-p: Below are the projects I have contributed to. Feel free to click the "See more" button to find the details of each project.
ProjectPage.description-second-p: For now, the links either point to the (online) deployed website or to the GitHub repository where you can find the code and project details.
ProjectPage.upcoming: Many ideas for upcoming projects! Probably using ReactJS, Django, and PostgreSQL
